content:
@CuriousDev Sure! The EVM stores data in 32-byte storage slots. When you have multiple small variables, the EVM tries to pack them into the same slot to save gas.

Here's a detailed example:

```solidity
struct User {
    address wallet;     // 20 bytes (slot 0)
    uint96 balance;     // 12 bytes (fits in remaining space of slot 0)
    bool isActive;      // 1 byte (slot 1)
    uint8 level;        // 1 byte (fits in slot 1)
    uint240 extraData;  // 30 bytes (fits in remaining space of slot 1)
}
```

This struct uses only 2 storage slots instead of 5! Each storage operation costs ~20,000 gas, so this saves ~60,000 gas per struct write.
